| Modified by @0xdavinchee","details":"A negative sideReceiverPortion portion is not allowed A portion > 1000 is fine though because the protocol will revert when trying to create a flow with a negative flow rate A flowRate which is less than 1000 will be rounded down to 0 and will revert Also an inflow which does not contain a whole number will be rounded down, this will also lead to a revert.","errors":{"NotAcceptedSuperToken()":[{"details":"Thrown when SuperTokens not accepted by the SuperApp are streamed to it"}],"NotImplemented()":[{"details":"Thrown if a required callback trying to create a flow     because the protocol does not allow creating flows with a flow rate of 0     Also, if the sum of the two outflows is not equal to the inflow, it means the app will     receive a residual flow.","params":{"flowRate_":"the inflow rate","sideReceiverPortion_":"the portion of the inflow to be redirected to SIDE_RECEIVER"},"returns":{"mainFlowRate":"the outflow rate to MAIN_RECEIVER","sideFlowRate":"the outflow rate to SIDE_RECEIVER"}},"isAcceptedSuperToken(address)":{"details":"checks that only the acceptedToken is used when sending streams into this of inflows to be redirected to SIDE_RECEIVER"}}},"stateVariables":{"ACCEPTED_SUPER_TOKEN":{"details":"Super Token that the FlowSplitter will accept streams of"},"MAIN_RECEIVER":{"details":"Account that ought to be routed the majority of the inflows"},"SIDE_RECEIVER":{"details":"Accout that ought to be routed the minority of the inflows"},"sideReceiverPortion":{"details":"number out of 1000 representing portion of inflows to be redirected to SIDE_RECEIVER      Ex: 300 would represent getMainAndSideReceiverFlowRates(int96,in.details: If either returns 0, it will revert when trying to create a flow     because the protocol does not allow creating flows with a flow rate of 0     Also, if the sum of the two outflows is not equal to the inflow, it means the app will     receive a residual flow.

params.sideReceiverPortion_: the portion of the inflow to be redirected to SIDE_RECEIVER

isAcceptedSuperToken(address).details: checks that only the acceptedToken is used when sending streams into this contract

params.superToken_: the token being streamed into the contract

params.newSideReceiverPortion_: the new portion of inflows to be redirected to SIDE_RECEIVER

getMainAndSideReceiverFlowRates(int96,in.notice: Returns the outflow rates to main and side receiver given flowRate_ and an arbitrary sideReceiverPortion_

updateSplit(int96).notice: Updates the split of the outflow to MAIN_RECEIVER and SIDE_RECEIVER

documentation.text: @dev Account that ought to be routed the majority of the inflows
@dev Accout that ought to be routed the minority of the inflows
@dev Super Token that the FlowSplitter will accept streams of

@dev number out of 1000 representing portion of inflows to be redirected to SIDE_RECEIVER
      Ex: 300 would represent 30%
@dev emitted when the split of the outflow to MAIN_RECEIVER and SIDE_RECEIVER is updated

@dev checks that only the acceptedToken is used when sending streams into this contract
 @param superToken_ the token being streamed into the contract
